intro: Dioscorea yucatanensis, commonly known as Yucatan arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are the primary part used for culinary purposes. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are heart-shaped and can reach up to 30 cm in length, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in spikes. The tubers are starchy and have a mild flavor, making them a traditional ingredient in local cuisines.
